jd: From: priyanka, Stellent IT priyanka@stellentit.com Reply to: priyanka@stellentit.com Title: Project Manager/Scrum MasterLocation: Murray, UT (HYBRID/ONLY LOCAL WITH DL)Visa: USC, GC, EADProject projected to end on December 31st, 2024 About the jobWe are currently seeking a Project Manager/Scrum Master to join our project management team. The project manager that we seek will be responsible for managing multiple elements of software development projects. As part of our team, you will be working with the development staff, internal teams, and various levels of management. This role is an important part of our ability to deliver software solutions that help our customers understand and act on third-party cyber security risk. You will enjoy this role if you are willing to:Support company objectives and leadershipDig in, learn and challenge yourselfBe passionate about your workReceive constructive feedback and guidanceKeep an eye on the detailsBe open-minded and have a positive attitudeLend a hand and be a team playerDrive toward successful and timely delivery of projectsCore Responsibilities Include:Plan, organize and monitor software development projects.Flexibility to adjust and adapt to changing priorities or projects.Facilitate testing, coordination and release planning for software projects.Report project progress, metrics and risks through established methods.Support development and maintenance of project artifacts as required.Participate in all phases of software development lifecycle (SDLC)Use established processes for the management of the projects.Manage project resources appropriately.Maintain positive relationships with the project team.Monitor project teams to ensure that they are moving successfully toward on-time delivery of the project and features.Provide direction and support to the project team.Facilitate and assist with meetings related to all aspects of the project life cycle.Document and create user stories, TDD scenarios, and other requirement details as necessary.Communicate and mitigate risksQualifications & Skills:High School Degree or equivalent.An associate or bachelor’s degree in computer science, Business Administration, Information Systems or related disciplines.Computer skills including Office Suite, Video conferencing, keyboarding, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio.7+ years of Software Development Project Management or IT Project Management experience.PMP or Certified Scrum Master certification.Familiar with business analysis and elicitation methods.Experience with creating technical and user story documentation.Previous experience with software integrations projects.Excellent organizational, written and verbal communication skills.Exceptional time management skills.Strong work ethic with a sense of urgency.Interact and communicate effectively with stakeholders, technical staff, internal teams and management across all levels.Experience managing distributed teams.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Capable of working with minimal supervision after training.Knowledge of Test-Driven Development (TDD) concepts.Applicants must pass a drug and background screen to qualify.Experience with Zoom, Skype and Microsoft Teams.Work Environment:Requires standing or sitting at your desk.Use a computer and technical accessories as needed.Need to be available to work standard business hours Mountain Standard TimeOffice is located in Murray, UT
